exceptions.exn: In environment a, b : nat H, H1 : list_repeat One a = list_repeat One b Unable to unify "b" with "a".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: nat
a: nat

Goal:
list_repeat One a = list_repeat One b -> a = b

Premises:
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
Notation One := true
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
list_One_Zero_inj : forall (a b : nat) (l m : list bool), list_repeat One a ++ Zero :: l = list_repeat One b ++ Zero :: m -> a = b /\ l = m
list_One_Zero_not : forall (a b : nat) (l : list bool), list_repeat One a ++ Zero :: l <> list_repeat One b
list_repeat_plus : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (a b : nat), list_repeat x (a + b) = list_repeat x a ++ list_repeat x b
elt_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A) (a b : A), l1 ++ a :: l2 = b :: nil -> a = b /\ l1 = nil /\ l2 = nil
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, BinNums.N0) | BinNums.Npos na => match b with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, a) | BinNums.Npos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N * BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.div_eucl (_ _)%N_scope
bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list bool) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe2
bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : list bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lH -> forall lmp : list (bool * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol bool), Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) bool_eq (triv_div Zero One bool_eq) lH = lmp ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) Zero One bool_eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) (get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
nat_sorted = fun ll : list nat => forall (l : list nat) (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat), ll = l ++ a :: m ++ b :: r -> a < b : list nat -> Prop Arguments nat_sorted _%list_scope
BoolTheory = {| Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then One else Zero) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb One b = xorb b One) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb Zero b = xorb b Zero) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb One (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb One b) z) then fun z : bool => if z as b return (xorb One (xorb One b) = xorb (xorb One One) b) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun z : bool...
map_eq_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (b : B), map f l = b :: l' -> exists (a : A) (tl : list A), l = a :: tl /\ f a = b /\ map f tl = l'
list_bool_choose_sym : forall lb : list bool, {k : nat & {tl : list bool | lb = list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: tl}} + {k : nat | lb = list_repeat One k}
Record div_theory (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (phi : C -> R) (cdiv : C -> C -> C * C) : Prop := mkdiv_th { div_eucl_th : forall a b : C, let (q, r) := cdiv a b in req (phi a) (phi (cadd (cmul b q) r)) } Arguments div_theory [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments mkdiv_th [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
list_bool_choose : forall lb : list bool, {k : nat & {tl : list bool | lb = list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: tl}} + {k : nat | lb = list_repeat Zero k}
list_nat_bool = fix list_nat_bool (ln : list nat) : list bool := match ln with | nil => nil | x :: ll => list_repeat Zero x ++ One :: list_nat_bool ll end : list nat -> list bool Arguments list_nat_bool _%list_scope
ext_in_filter : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l -> forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a
ext_in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = map g l -> forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
Ascii.N_of_digits = fix N_of_digits (l : list bool) : BinNums.N := match l with | nil => BinNums.N0 | b :: l' => BinNat.N.add (if b then BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH else BinNums.N0) (BinNat.N.mul (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (N_of_digits l')) end : list bool -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_digits _%list_scope
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => 0 | BinNums.Npos p => BinPos.Pos.to_nat p end : BinNums.N -> nat Arguments BinNatDef.N.to_nat _%N_scope
map_list_repeat : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (x : X) (n : nat), map f (list_repeat x n) = list_repeat (f x) n
list_an_app_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ r -> l = list_an a (length l) /\ r = list_an (a + length l) (length r)
list_an_spec : forall a n m : nat, In m (list_an a n) < -> a <= m < a + n
list_an_length : forall a n : nat, length (list_an a n) = n
map_cst_repeat : forall (X Y : Type) (y : Y) (ll : list X), map (fun _ : X => y) ll = list_repeat y (length ll)
Inductive list_bool_succ : list bool -> list bool -> Prop := in_lbs_0 : forall (k : nat) (l : list bool), list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l) | in_lbs_1 : forall k : nat, list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k) (list_repeat Zero (S k)) Arguments list_bool_succ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lbs_0 _%nat_scope _%list_scope Arguments in_lbs_1 _%nat_scope
bool_eq_ok : forall b1 b2 : bool, bool_eq b1 b2 = One -> b1 = b2
list_bool_invalid = fun (k : nat) (lb : list bool) (ln : list nat) => exists lc : list bool, lb = list_nat_bool ln ++ lc /\ (Exists (fun x : nat => k <= x) ln \/ Forall (fun x : nat => x < k) ln /\ (exists p : nat, lc = list_repeat Zero (S p))) : nat -> list bool -> list nat -> Prop Arguments list_bool_invalid _%nat_scope (_ _)%list_scope
QArith_base.Qeq_bool_eq : forall x y : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq_bool x y = One -> QArith_base.Qeq x y
exists_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l <> nil -> {l' : list A & {a : A | l = l' ++ a :: nil}}
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker_sound : forall (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof), ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker f w = One -> forall env : RingMicromega.PolEnv BinNums.Z, Tauto.eval_bf (ZMicromega.Zeval_formula env) f
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = One
in_lbs_0 : forall (k : nat) (l : list bool), list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l)
Record sign_theory (C : Type) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (get_sign : C -> option C) : Prop := mksign_th { sign_spec : forall c c' : C, get_sign c = Some c' -> ceqb c (copp c') = One } Arguments sign_theory [C]%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope Arguments mksign_th [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope
in_eq : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l : list A), In a (a :: l)
list_bool_decomp : forall (k : nat) (lb : list bool), {ln : list nat & {lc : list bool | lb = list_nat_bool ln ++ lc /\ Exists (fun x : nat => k <= x) ln}} + {ln : list nat & {r : nat | lb = list_nat_bool ln ++ list_repeat Zero r /\ Forall (fun x : nat => x < k) ln}}
IDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = One -> req x y) -> ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp reqb (IDphi (R:=R))
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => match m with | BinNums.N0 => One | BinNums.Npos _ => Zero end | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => Zero | BinNums.Npos q => BinPos.Pos.eqb p q end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope
list_bool_nat = fix list_bool_nat (l : list bool) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | One :: l0 => 1 + 2 * list_bool_nat l0 | Zero :: l0 => 0 + 2 * list_bool_nat l0 end : list bool -> nat Arguments list_bool_nat _%list_scope
in_lbs_1 : forall k : nat, list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k) (list_repeat Zero (S k))
